entries.content: by Duane Capizzi and Steven Roberts
EXT. -- A FARMHOUSE OUTSIDE NEW YORK CITY -- NIGHT

On the farmhouse roof a CHICKEN-SHAPED WEATHERVANE stands silhouettedagainst a FULL, BLOOD-RED MOON. The wind HOWLS and the vane swivels withan EERIE SQUEAK. Then a weird ANIMAL CRY is heard--a cross between achicken CROWING and a wolf HOWLING.
A fenced-in dirt area with numerous CHICKENS milling around, CLUCKING asthey peck at the ground.
(ANOTHER HOWL, nearer now) The chickens' heads jerk up toward the sound.
A RED-tinted, shaky, MOVING CAMERA TRUCK-IN on the chickens. (These shotsare in the style of the POV SHOTS in WOLFEN.) Magnified GURGLING andHEAVY BREATHING of Werechicken is heard.
The terrified chickens stare INTO CAMERA as the Werechicken moves closer,his shadow falling over them. They flap into their coop, SQUAWKINGwildly.
MAUDE and ZEKE sit on the sagging couch watching a werewolf movie on TVwhile munching popcorn from a huge bowl. They're distracted by CHICKENS
Sump'n's stirrin' up the chickens, Maude.
Jes' set easy, Zeke. (she rises; heads for door) I'll take a look-see.

Through the Werechicken's red eyes, we see a distant image of Maude with aflashlight, approaching the fenced-in chicken pen and opening the gate.CAMERA STARTS MOVING IN toward Maude as she enters, leaving gate open.
The dirt compound is empty now as Maude crosses toward wooden chickencoop.
AS Maude ENTERS from OUT OF CAMERA, her flashlight beam illuminates thechickens cowering on their roosts in a corner. They CLUCK nervously.
What's got you girls so durned upset? There a coyote sneakin' 'round?
Suddenly the Werechicken's shadow moves up Maude's back, then the wall.
Maude looks over her shoulder AT CAMERA, reacts.
Red-eyed, grotesque, three times the size of an ordinary rooster as itstands framed in the moonlit doorway. It opens its fanged beak in ahorrifying SHRIEK as it springs AT CAMERA, wings flapping.
INT. FARMHOUSE LIVING ROOM - CLOSE ON TV
Old black-and-white movie. MELODRAMATIC MUSIC as a man turns into awerewolf, his HOWL a continuation of the previous Werechicken SHRIEK.
continues watching TV and eating popcorn. Maude walks stiffly into roombehind him, eyes staring blankly.
(without looking up) Everythin' okay out there, Maude?
She stares with glassy, red eyes and CLUCKS quietly.

PAN DOWN below Maude's waist to reveal that she's turning into a chickenfrom the feet up. First her shoes RIP apart as large, yellow chicken feetsprout. Then her dress SWELLS and SPLITS, revealing a large, featheredbody underneath. The only piece of clothing left on her is her apron. Onefoot scratches the floor.

Now completely transformed and six feet tall, she leaps up to perch onback of couch, THRUSTING her chicken head repeatedly into the popcorn bowlin Zeke's lap, pecking the bowl clean. Zeke's jaw hangs open, speechless,as he stares at the fanged, drooling, six-foot Werechicken. TheWerechicken looks up from the empty bowl, right in Zeke's terrified eyes.
He scrambles backwards off the couch.
SCENE RED-tinted. We hear loud SQUAWKING from within house as chickenfeathers fly out the open windows.
Watching from slight hilltop. Its beak seems to bend into an insidiousgrin.
As CAMERA MOVES IN, we hear:
Egon, could you hold off on the weather balloon bit for a minute?
INT. -- LABORATORY -- ON PETER AND RAY

They stand holding big plastic bags of trash, obviously annoyed at theO.S. Egon. Ray's armful of trash is piled so high that he can't see overit. SLIMER hovers behind, sticking his nose in one of the bags like adog. He finally dives right into it.
It's Your night to take out the trash.
And Winston's in the kitchen doing your dishes.
He's busy testing his WEATHER BALLOON--a large, pink bubble half the sizeof the room. He moves a lever on its remote control unit and the balloonrises.
(preoccupied; through above) Be with you in ... (checks watch) ...one minute, fifty-three seconds.

Peter and Ray exchange pained glances. Peter awkwardly attempts to pickup another trash bag while Ray stumbles around, his vision blocked. PANWITH THEM as they move toward door when Egon's weather balloon suddenlylowers INTO FRAME. They bounce into and off of it, which sends the trashbags flying.
(AD-LIB REACTIONS as they bounce off balloon)
Peter stumbles backwards and lands butt-first right on one of the bags.Slimer SQUEALS from within it.
Then he comes shooting out the back of the bag, the lower half of his bodyflat as a Frisbee.
shakes himself off like a dog, spraying slime all over Peter.
(pissed; sarcastic) Thanks, Slimer. I really needed that!
Ray helps Peter up as the telephone RINGS and RINGS.
The RINGING phone is right beside him on the workbench.
(preoccupied with remote controls) In a minute, Ray.
He ENTERS with sleeves rolled up, wiping a plate with a dish towel andwearing an apron.
(sarcastic) Nevermind, Egon, wouldn't want you to strain yourself. (picks up phone) Ghostbusters Central.
Calm down... Where are you?... (a BEAT as he listens) We'll be right there.
Peter and Ray again have their arms full of trash bags. Even Slimer isdragging one.
Ready for this one? Some farmer says his wife was eaten by a giant chicken.
Hey, even a half-baked false alarm sounds better than doing Egon's chores. (he drops trash bags) Let's roll!
Ray and Slimer also abandon their trash bags and EXIT with Peter andWinston.
still oblivious as he works in the suddenly empty room.
I think I've finally perfected it. Watch this, guys. (a BEAT, he looks around over shoulder) Guys?
ECTO-1 roars INTO CAMERA, siren and lights going.
The Ghostbusters, minus Egon, are wearing their gear. Slimer hovers inback seat.
It sure feels strange not having Egon with us.
(sarcastic) Why? Lately even when he's with us, he's not with us.
But wouldn't it be somethin' if he sells that weather balloon idea of his? He'll be a rich man!
Good. Then he can hire a maid to do his share of the chores.
As it speeds OUT OF CAMERA toward distant farmhouse, PAN OVER TO theapron-wearing Maude-Chicken silhouetted in the moonlight, nesting in ahaystack. MOVE IN TO --
Her body starts to shake, she ruffles her wings.
Then she suddenly sits up and leaps off the haystack, revealing anenormous egg beneath her. Maude SQUAWKS and CLUCKS and struts off into acornfield, pecking away at ears of corn.
Ray, Winston and Slimer listen seriously as Zeke speaks, but Peter'sobviously not buying it.
Had big blood-red eyes, it did. Biggest dang chicken I ever seen. Mebbe six feet tall.
Did it have any distinguishing marks?
Peter grabs Ray's arm, starts ushering him to front door.
(over shoulder as he goes) Thank you, Sir. We'll put out a missing chicken report right away.
As the three Ghostbusters and Slimer cross toward Ecto-1 parked in front.
(as they go) This one's easy, guys. Old Zeke's been watchin' too many horror movies and eating too much greasy popcorn.
No, Peter, I think we're dealing with a bonafide werechicken here.
Peter and Winston stop, look at Ray in disbelief.
Ray points at ground. Peter, Winston and Slimer look down.
Peter is standing with both feet in two enormous chicken footprints.
The three Ghostbusters follow Maude's "chicken" tracks with powerfulflashlights across a field spotted with haystacks. Slimer moves ahead,nose to ground like a bloodhound.
He floats along above the flashlight-illuminated tracks which lead himright into the haystack. We hear a BONK from within, then:
Slimer backs OUT INTO SHOT rubbing his head. He looks up and his eyes popwide.
The Ghostbusters ENTER SHOT and play their flashlights across the huge eggsitting atop the haystack.
(excited) What'd I tell you, Peter? A werechicken egg! Gimme a hand, Winston!
As Ray and Winston ease the egg down off the haystack. Peter holds hisPKE meter up to it.
Look, if this is a werechicken egg,
Ray and Winston still hold giant egg.
(looking at meter in Peter's hand) I dunno... that is strange.
Let's get it back to Headquarters and run some tests. Then maybe we'll have some answers.
Oh no, I'm not leavin'. The werechicken that laid this has gotta be around here someplace -- and I'm gonna find it.
(throws up his hands with heavy SIGH) I'll take it. C'mon, Slimer.
They take egg from Ray and Winston and start back toward Ecto-l.
(shaking his head; as he goes) Werechickens.
Through its RED EYES we see, from a distance, Peter and Slimer carryingthe egg, Ray and Winston moving off in other direction.
Egon still busy with his balloon as Peter and Slimer carry egg in throughdoor.
(through above) Yo, balloon man, we've got some real work for you: How about analyzing this?
Egon looks around, reacts to egg.
Interesting. That's the second biggest egg I've ever seen.
Peter and Slimer set egg on Egon's desk.
I don't wanna hear about it, Egon. We've had a long night in a not-too-fragrant barnyard, so I'm taking a shower and hitting the sheets.

Peter EXITS as Slimer ZIPS in close beside Egon, elbows on desk, chin inhands, eyeing Egon and egg expectantly. Egon pushes glasses up off tip ofnose and blinks at egg, not sure what to do with it. CAMERA MOVES IN onegg and we --
EXT. -- FULL MOON IN COUNTRY SKY -- NIGHT
CAMERA PANS DOWN from full moon to reveal the tiny figures of Ray andWinston approaching an old barn. They stop, shining their flashlights onclosed main door.
(tired) Ray, it's gettin' pretty late. Maybe there really isn't any...
Ray extends his PKE meter toward barn. It BEEPS incessantly.
(unclipping his blaster) Then let's get it!
INT. BARN -- HIGH ANGLE ON MAIN DOOR -- WERECHICKEN'S POV
Through its RED EYES we see the barn door slowly CREAK open, revealing Rayand Winston peering in.

They ENTER cautiously, Ray holding his BEEPING meter out before him. Thebarn is dark except for the moonlight slanting through the loft window andthe beams of their flashlights. As the WIND picks up, WOOD CREAKS, HAYRUSTLES, and a piece of JUNKY machinery turns with a SQUEAL.
It's in here -- I can feel it.
Suddenly the door SLAMS shut behind them and the FLAP OF BEATING WINGSSCURRIES through the darkness. Winston JUMPS.
Ray shines his flashlight toward the lofts. Its beam catches a couple ofstartled pigeons as they fly out the window, pinion feathers WHISTLING.
RED-TINTED, moving slowly toward Ray and Winston from behind.
They stop as PKE meter starts BEEPING. Ray checks the reading.
We see only its face. The blood-red eyes stare menacingly, its fangedbeak slightly open and drooling.
It hops forward into a streak of moonlight. It's three feet tall, itswings hang out at the sides, and its evil, blood-red eyes stare at CAMERA.
THE WERECHICKEN suddenly leaps AT CAMERA.
ZOOM-IN on Winston and Ray. They open fire.
The proton streams catch the Werechicken in mid-air as it vaults towardRay and Winston, halting its leap and suspending it in a corona of protonenergy.
A HIDEOUS SPIRIT rises from its writhing body -- shapeless, but withmonstrous glowing eyes and fangs. The spirit lets out a ROAR morefrightening than the Werechicken howl.
Ray, still firing his gun, snaps a trap loose from his belt, and tosses itonto the barn floor. It POPS open.
Ray and Winston, struggling with the writhing Spirit caught in thestreams, guide the Spirit into the trap.
The Spirit is sucked into the trap, which SLAMS shut.
A normal chicken with singed feathers stands where the Werechicken was.It CLUCKS, starts pecking at the dirt.
(looking at chicken) Well, that takes care of one werechicken.
Ray picks up the smoking trap.
Now to find the six-footer that ate Zeke's wife.
They head for the door. Winston stops.
Ray, I just had a thought...
Ray pauses to look around at Winston.
What if that six-foot werechicken is Zeke's wife?
Egon carries the big egg into kitchen, Slimer helping.
(straining) Thanks for the help, Slimer, but I don't have time to examine this egg tonight. I have to prepare for my weather balloon demonstration tomorrow morning.
With his elbow, Egon opens refrigerator with and the two of them place thegiant egg inside.
(through above) But it'll be safe in here.
Slimer is SNORING, hovering above Peter's empty bed.

In a BUBBLE above him, we see Slimer's DREAM, various kinds of fooddancing and SINGING the first two bars of Los Lobos' "LA BAMBA" a la theCalifornia Raisins in "I Heard It Through The Grapevine." Still asleep,Slimer licks his lips hungrily, opens his mouth incredibly wide andpounces on the entire dream balloon with a teeth-jarring CHOMP! that POPSthe dream bubble so that it EXPLODES inside his mouth, waking him up.Slimer sits up with a wide-eyed, hungry look, rubbing his tummy.
Dark. Lights go on, then Slimer SKIDS to mid-air stop and whips openfridge. His eyes pop as he sees the egg.

Slimer rolls egg toward edge of shelf, then the full weight of the eggdrives Slimer straight to the floor. The egg bounces on his stomach twicebefore he gets a grip on it. Straining his little green brains out, hefloats the egg up into the air and o.s.
Slimer shoves egg in the open oven, closes door, turns on the heat, thenmoves O.S. The oven interior glows red and the egg starts to quiver.
Slimer HUMS as he busily sets table for one: placemat, a plate, utensils,salt, pepper, ketchup, mustard, mayo, relish, ... a flurry of activitythat all focuses on his personal eating spot.
Through window we see the egg shake and then begin to crack open.
Hovering at table, still preparing for feast. He puts on a bib, unawareof oven shaking behind him.
With a loud BANG, the oven practically explodes and the door flies off.Out pops a BABY WERECHICKEN, SNARLING and CACKLING.
His eyes bug and his paw drops.
Slimer barrels up through sink faucet, leaving his bib stuck in theopening.
Slimer comes shooting out through shower nozzle, hugs Peter tightly aroundthe neck and scaring the hell out of him.
(startled YELL; then:) Slimer! How 'bout some privacy??
Egon works at his table. A now familiar Werechicken shadow appears overhis shoulder and grows up the wall.
CLOSER ANGLE - REAR VIEW ON EGON
Werechicken creeps OUT OF CAMERA, bites Egon on the rear and pulls backo.s., chicken claws CLATTERING off into distance.
Dazed, he looks down at his feet.
Chicken toes pop through the leather, one at a time.
As Egon's transformation continues: His coveralls RIP apart at the legs,then midriff, then his arms turn into wings. Finally, a beak sprouts fromhis face.
Peter (now dressed and wearing his backpack) runs up to lab door andflings it open, Slimer right behind him.
Peter and Slimer look in, not seeing Egon, who is now a six-foot-tallwerechicken, but still wearing his glasses, standing behind door.
Egon? (to Slimer) Well, Slimer, I don't see anything here that looks like a monster.
The Egon-Chicken jumps out right in front of Peter and Slimer.
Slimer freaks and rockets right through the nearest wall.
He flaps his wings wildly, his red eyes bulging, and GROWLS, revealingimpressive fangs.
Egon the Werechicken moves toward Peter, fangs bared in attack mode.
He steps back into doorway, blaster leveled at Egon-Chicken, and SNAPS onthe power. It HUMS to life.
(horrified) What'd you do to Egon, you bird-brain!
A hand grabs Peter by the arm fust as the thrower fires, sending theproton stream off at an angle into ceiling, barely missing the chicken.
as Ray pulls Peter out into corridor, Winston kicks door shut in theEgon-Chicken's snarling face and quickly locks it. Slimer hovers nearbylooking worried.
The door SHAKES and SHUDDERS as the unseen Egon-Chicken tries to breakthrough.
(irritated; through above) What's wrong with you guys? That thing ate Egon!
Peter, that is Egon! The egg hatched, he was bitten and now he's a werechicken!
The door behind them is starting to splinter and bulge from the batteringof the Egon-Chicken.
(looking at door) You're kidding! (a BEAT, then) Come to think of it, there was a certain resemblance.
(looking toward door) What happened? He's so quiet all of a sudden.
Looking toward o.s. window, he reacts.
Ray stops at window, looks out. Beyond we see the full moon. Peter,Winston and Slimer come up behind him.
It's beginning to disappear, right to left.
All looking out window as eclipse continues
Ray, what's this have to do with Egon being a chicken?
(turning to others) Werechickens only appear during a full moon, and for the next few minutes, the moon's not full.
Door opens and Ray pecks in.
Seen from the waist up (he's not wearing clothes), looking around,confused. He sees Ray.
Egon is holding his tattered coveralls in front of his waist, like askirt.
Suddenly Slimer flies INTO SHOT and gives Egon a big, sloppy kiss.
Sit down, Egon, we have some good news and some bad news.
You've been turned into a werechicken!
His glasses slip to the end of his nose as his eyes widen. He pushes themback up.
He hurriedly thumbs through the TOBIN SPIRIT GUIDE.

(flipping through book) Were-aardvarks ... were-bears werechickens! (reads) "The werechicken appears during the full moon. Anyone it bites will turn into another werechicken." (he looks at Egon) That egg Peter brought in, it hatched and...
(through above) I remember the bite clearly. How long will I stay like this?
(looking in Tobin's Guide) According to this, there is an antidote. But we've gotta move fast -- the eclipse only lasts three minutes!
Slimer scrambles through the cupboard, grabbing various bottles of stuff,and hands them to Winston who adds ingredients to mixing bowl and stirswhile Ray reads from Tobin's Guide.
(reading through above) "One tablespoon paprika, one clove of garlic, some parsley for color, cup of gelatin..."
Through it we see the eclipsed moon starting to emerge from shadow.
His pupils look constricted and he's perspiring.
Peter steps INTO SHOT, puts arm around Egon's shoulders.
(through above) Take it easy, Egon. You're gonna be fine. (SHOUTS O.S.; worried) Hurry it up, guys!
INT. KITCHEN -- ON WINSTON AND RAY
He rummages through shelves, then looks down at Ray.
Ray and winston exchange panicky looks.
Then we've gotta go with this! C'mon!
They run OUT with the mixing bowl of liquid. Slimer follows.
INT. LAB -- CLOSE ON EGON'S LEGS
They're once again turning into chicken legs and chicken feet. Toespopping out like popcorn.
As Peter and Egon stare down at the chicken legs and chicken feet.
Ray, Slimer and Winston rush INTO SHOT.
Winston hands the bowl of potion to Egon, who gulps it down.
As Egon drinks, his arms transform into wings and he drops the bowl,breaking it.
As the transformation and feathers rise up his shoulders. Suddenly,the transformation stops at the neck. DRAMATIC MUSIC STOPS, too.
ON PETER, RAY, WINSTON AND SLIMER
They stare, wide-eyed. After A BEAT --
To include Egon, who is once again a six-foot-tall chicken, but withEgon's own neck and head.
The potion only partly worked, because of the missing chickenbane.
Don't get your feathers ruffled, Peter. There's a logical solution to every problem.
Strands of slime stand straight up on the nape of Slimer's "neck" at thesound -- like a frightened cat -- and he dives into a test tube in a rackon Egon's workbench.
The werechicken that bit Egon. It's still out there somewhere.
(to others) Let's stop that thing before it makes drumsticks out of anyone else! (to Egon) Un, no offense, Egon.
The three normal Ghostbusters dash toward door.
ECTO-2 glides over the city, running lights blinking.
Peter at the controls. Slimer sits beside him, looking down at the citythrough binoculars.
(into radio mike) All quiet on the chicken front. How about down there?
Winston driving. Ray on the radio.
(gives Ray a dirty look) No pun intended.
Several people run out front door SCREAMING as ECTO-1 passes.
Winston and Ray look back at exiting people.
As it makes a SCREECHING U-turn.
Ecto-1 SKIDS up, doors open, and Ray and Winston leap out, blasters at theready, running toward store entrance.
Ray and winston run in and stop inside door beside a panicked BOX BOY whopoints o.s.
(breathless) It's in there! A big chicken! It's gotta be ten feet tall!
(nods) Maybe fifteen, I dunno. Big! (he runs o.s.) I'm outta here!
They run off in opposite directions, flanking the long aisles.
PAN WITH him as he cautiously moves along, aisle by aisle. At far end ofaisles, Winston can be seen doing the same. The market is thrashed,spilled groceries everywhere.
As they reach the last aisle. No chicken. Ray joins Winston.
How could we lose a fifteen foot-tall chicken?
He's hiding under his butcher block, trembling. Ray and Winston run INTOSHOT. The Butcher looks up, eyes wide.
A giant chicken just came through here -- it was thirty feet tall!
The Butcher is pointing out open door. Beyond is a parking lot with atrail of crushed cars right down the middle.
Yeah! Look what it did to those cars!
Ray and Winston race out the door.
EXT. INDUSTRIAL DISTRICT - WIDE ON ECTO-2 FLYING -- NIGHT
The little chopper, lights blinking, skims low past three-and four-storybuildings.
(into radio) It's how big? Okay, Ray, I admit you were right about these Werechickens,...
...but I definitely don't buy them growing to the size of buildings.
(covers mouth, LAUGHTER FIZZING through his closed, flapping lips. "How absurd.")
Suddenly, the head of the Werechicken rears up INTO SHOT right in front ofRay and Slimer.
ECTO-2 is buffeted about by the howl as Peter jams the stick forward.
It makes a steep, banking dive and gets the hell out of there, barelyescaping the big Werechicken's beak that SNAPS shut on thin air justbehind Ecto-2's retreating tail.
Peter is shaken, but in control. Slimer is trembling like green Jell-O.
(into mike) Ray, you were right! The chicken's here, and he's a walking high-rise!
Winston floors it and he and Ray accelerate forward INTO CAMERA.
Egon is "perched" on the window sill, looking pensively out at the city,still a chicken from the neck down. A BEAT, then:
Startled, Egon flutters up off the sill, gravity takes over, and he landson his feathered butt.
Revealing Janine standing frozen in the doorway, eyes wide with disbelief,hands to her cheeks.
It's a long story, Janine. Can you get my coat, please? I'm due at the weather board in forty-five...
She stares at Egon, totally bewildered.
But what ...? (thinks better of asking) Nevermind.
Janine takes a long yellow raincoat off a door hook and helps him into it.He's completely covered except for his head and feet.
Are you sure you wanna go to a meeting like -- this?
Trust me. I'm of sound mind at least.
As he struts toward the door, we see his tail protruding through a slit inthe back of coat. He EXITS, CLUCKING.
EXT. MID-TOWN MANHATTAN -- ANGLE ON WERECHICKEN
It walks along stepping on cars, kicking over telephone poles, etc., a laGodzilla. The streets SHAKE. Panicky pedestrians flee the Werechicken'sgiant feet.
Peter and Slimer are following giant chicken.
(into radio) It's heading down 34th toward the Empire State Building.
Ecto-1 SPEEDS around a corner, SIREN blaring.
Sun rises behind the werechicken as it approaches in distance. With eachHOWL, the streets SHAKE.
Approaching CAMERA fast, it SCREECHES to a halt. Doors fly open. Ray andWinston LEAP out, open fire, their proton streams angling upward.
Moving toward them down the concrete canyon, flattening street lamps andpower poles. Ecto-2 can be seen flying above and behind it. The protonstreams are up toward it.
Slimer grabs the control stick in both hands as Peter leans out to oneside with his blaster and fires downward.

Caught in the three crossing streams. It FLAILS about, knocking overstreet lights and bashing in the sides of buildings, and lets out adeafening HOWL. A MONSTROUS SPIRIT emerges from its body and fills thescreen like a transparent film.
As Ray, Winston and Peter's beams draw the Spirit toward the trap.
Ray's boot stomps on trigger and trap springs open. As the Spirit comesinto contact with the trap a small STORM ERUPTS around it. SPARKS andLIGHTNING BOLTS fly. A HURRICANE-like WIND BLOWS.
Being buffeted by wind, struggling to hang onto their throwers as theycontinue firing. They have to SHOUT over the NOISE.
(loud) Trap's full! Somebody forgot to empty it!
The wind is really bouncing it around. Slimer has his hands full, whilePeter continues shooting.
Light FLASHES rapidly. Trap begins to shake and glow.
It banks, gets the hell away.

turn off their proton guns and are KNOCKED down by the released force asthe freed Monstrous Spirit whooshes skyward. The STORM abruptlydisappears, as if SUCKED up. The trap stops shaking and SNAPS shut.
As the Spirit POPS back into its body, JARRING it. Its chicken facecontorts with new ANGER.
It turns and starts up the side of the Empire State Building.
The werechicken is halfway to the top. PULL BACK to reveal Peter, Slimer,Winston and Ray standing in street looking up at him. Ecto-1 and 2 arebehind them.
So how're we gonna, put that big bird on ice, guys'
(SNAPS finger) Peter, that's not a bed idea! Chicken freezes at very low temperatures!
Yeah, but how do you freeze a 50-foot chicken in August?
A BEAT, then the three guys look at each other.
Not far from the Empire State Building. Egon stands before a group ofseated MEN and WOMEN --THE WEATHER BOARD -- in his rain coat. To oneside, the weather balloon hovers above them.
Distinguished members of the Weather Board, my weather balloon has the clu-cluck-clu- capability --
The top of the Empire State Building is visible behind him as he holds thesmall weather device control box in one winged hand.
... of entering the upper atmosphere where clu-cluck-clu cloud formations occur.
They look at each other, puzzled.
There, it can electronically alter weather cut-cut-cut-con-ditions to produce sun, rain, or...
Ecto-2 ascends into view behind him and hovers, the chopper's rotorsblowing Egon's raincoat up over his head, exposing the chicken bodyunderneath.
Their mouths drop open as they stare at Egon's chicken body.
He pulls raincoat down off his face, holding it in place with one hand ashe looks at audience with forced smile.
(to Board members) I, er, can explain this, but --
Slimer flies INTO SHOT beside Egon and WHISPERS in his ear.
He looks around to where Slimer is pointing.
As the Werechicken climbs into view, scaling the upper stories of theEmpire State Building.
The Weather Board members see the Werechicken and start to SCREAM.
He JUMPS onto a rope ladder hanging from Ecto-2 and climbs inside. Slimerflies in right behind him and Ecto-2 rises up OUT OF SHOT.
Egon settles into passenger seat. Slimer hovers behind them.
(loud over engine) Egon, can we freeze that big chicken with your weather balloons
(holds up wings) Yes, but you'll have to work the controls.
It banks off toward the Empire State Building as the Werechicken reachesthe top of the spire.
As it gets "comfortable" on the spire, fluffing its feathers. It beginsto quiver (like Maude did earlier when she laid an egg).
On street below, looking skyward through binoculars.
It looks like it's about to lay an --
Winston puts a hand over Ray's mouth.
(with dread) I don't want to hear it.
It rises from weather bureau rooftop, then drifts along horizontally, awayfrom the Empire State Building. It stops, then begins to rise again. Thesky darkens as the balloon rises into the clouds.
Peter, Egon, Slimer, as before. Peter operates the weather ballooncontrol box while Slimer flies the chopper.
Okay, Peter, the balloon's in position. Turn the lever to the extreme left.
CLOSE UP ON WEATHER CONTROL BOX
The balloon and surrounding clouds start to freeze, turning white andforming ice on them. Suddenly, snow starts to fall.
He sticks his tongue out and catches some snowflakes.
Blizzard-like snow pelts it. The chicken begins to stiffen and turn whitewith frost.
Snow falls on Ray and Winston as they gaze skyward.
A heavy snow continues to fall as CAMERA MOVES IN

Maude (back to normal) emerges from kitchen carrying a large, steamingbowl. Seated around the table are Egon (back to normal) Peter, Winston,Ray and Zeke. No Slimer. There are half-empty soup bowls in front ofeveryone and the diners all look full to the point of weariness -- exceptSlimer.
As he looks at bowl of soup Maude sets down.
spooning soup eagerly into his bowl.
I'm actually starting to like it.
No more werechicken problems for us, eh, Egon?
The Ghostbusters burst from their chairs and run o.s.
As the Ghostbusters cautiously advance, blasters ready.
It opens and the Ghostbusters peer in. Suddenly ...

A HUGE SHADOW on the lab wall, its head making a "pecking" motion like awerechicken. After a beat, PAN DOWN to reveal Slimer with a Walkman onhis head, "pecking" his head to the rhythm of his music. Slimer HOWLSagain ...
(big SIGH) It's just Slimer groovin' to his new James Brown tape.
As he continues to groove to the music.
(a la James Brown) I feel good! I knew that I would So good, so good, so good! (big James Brown HOWL as we --)
Peter turns to the others in disgust.
(long-suffering) Tell me, how do I get out of this chicken outfit?
